alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 10:35PM CDT until July 05 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR JO DAVIESS...NORTHWESTERN CARROLL...JACKSON AND SOUTHEASTERN DUBUQUE COUNTIES... At 1035 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from New Diggings to Delmar, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Maquoketa, Galena, Bellevue, Warren, Preston, Hanover, Elizabeth, Woodbine, Sabula, Miles, Andrew, Scales Mound, Apple River, La Motte, Menominee, Springbrook, Council Hill, St. Donatus, Spragueville and Green Island. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
